definition: to relieve and help
to cross a river/to aid or relieve/to be of help
only used in 濟濟|济济[ji3 ji3]
used in place names associated with the Ji River 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3]/surname Ji
to help/to assist

sentences.english: In the day of salvation I will help you.
sentences.chinese: 在拯救的日子，我济助了你。

sentences.english: The curator was to be jointly appointed by the two parties.
sentences.chinese: 济助令规定的临时管理人则由诉讼双方共同指定。

definition: to give relief aid
to help the poor
relief aid
to give relief (material)
to give material assistance to
to reduce payment/to annul (debts, bills, taxes etc)/to let sb off paying
to remove or lighten (a tax etc)
to provide relief/to aid
to let sb off (punishment, taxation etc)/to reprieve sb
(of an organization that has a duty of care) to give financial support to relatives of sb who has died or suffered serious injury
land tax/money and grain (given as tax or tribute)
assets/capital and materials
righteous deed
taxation/in former times, esp. land tax
to remove perils and solve disputes (idiom); to reconcile differences
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
